Article Title: Relatives, friends, teachers in attendance, it was largest-ever assembly for a CJI oath
Article Text: NEW DELHI: President Droupadi Murmu Monday administered the oath of office to Justice Surya Kant as the Chief Justice of India (CJI), the 53rd since the country became a Republic and the first from Haryana. Kant took oath in the name of God in presence of PM Narendra Modi, his Cabinet colleagues, Vice-President and Supreme Court and high court judges.CJI Kant's 235-strong guest list for the oath ceremony mirrored his endeavour to cherish the relationships he's nurtured since his days as an adolescent. Many nonagenarians and octogenarians who had watched him play as a boy on the dusty tracks of Petwar, a remote village in Hisar district, along with some of those who taught him in school and college, were part of the guest entourage that trotted into the dazzling Ashoka Hall to watch him being appointed the head of India's judiciary.Also present was outgoing CJI B R Gavai. Two eminent persons from Kant's home state - CM Naib Singh Saini and former Vice-President Jagdeep Dhankar - were seated in the front row.Justice Gavai gave his successor a warm hug after the oath ceremony. Though Justice Gavai had travelled to Rashtrapati Bhavan in CJI's official vehicle, he returned home in a car provided by Rashtrapati Bhavan.Usha Dahiya, now 85, had taught Justice Kant English in undergraduate course at Govt College, Hisar.Incidentally, Hisar was the first town he ever visited. Also among Justice Kant's guests were two professors - Ranvir Singh, the founding vice-chancellor of National Law University Delhi (NLUD) and K P S Mahalwar, who teaches at NLUD - who taught him law when he was a student of Maharshi Dayanand University, Rohtak. He got his law degree in 1984. Justice Kant touched the feet of his elders and teachers both before and after taking the oath.Kant's parents are no more, but his nonagenarian father-in-law and octogenarian mother-in-law were present on the occasion. Also in attendance were scores of his late father's friends, eager to share the proud moment for their 'boy' at the Rashtrapati Bhavan. His childhood friends, and relatives swelled the numbers.It hardly needs to be pointed out that for an overwhelming majority of the guests, this was their first brush with the grandeur and razzmatazz of a Rashtrapati Bhawan ceremony. The Rashtrapati Bhavan was kind enough to arrange seating facilities for all my guests, Justice Kant remarked.Monday's was the biggest-ever gathering of guests of a CJI at his oath ceremony and a testament to how relationships built in the hinterland decades ago stand the test of time.
Article Summary: President Droupadi Murmu administered the oath of office to Justice Surya Kant as the Chief Justice of India (CJI) He is the 53rd since the country became a Republic and the first from Haryana. Kant took oath in the name of God in presence of PM Narendra Modi, his Cabinet colleagues, Vice-President and Supreme Court and high court judges.

Article Title: 'For brothers who didn't return': Russian aerobatic team’s tribute to pilot killed in Tejas crash; watch video
Article Text:
Video credits: @Sputnik_India

‘In memory of our brothers’: Russian Pilot's Heartfelt Note For Indian Tejas Pilot After Dubai Crash

Also read |

NEW DELHI: Wing Commander Namansh Syal of the Indian Air Force was honoured with a ‘Missing Man’ manoeuvre by the Russian Knights aerobatics team after he was killed in a Tejas fighter jet crash at the Dubai Air Show on Friday.After the crash of the Indian Tejas fighter jet, the Russian Knights released a video of their performance at the Dubai Airshow 2025, paying tribute to the pilot and honouring the lives lost.In the video, shared on Russian social media platform VK, the team described the crash as “impossible to describe” and said their final-day performance was dedicated to the “memory of the brothers who did not return from the last flight”.At the air show, members of the US F-16 team also reacted strongly to the tragedy. Their pilot, Captain Taylor Hiester, said he was shocked that the event continued despite the fatal accident. The US team, along with a few others, chose to cancel their performance out of respect for the Indian pilot, his colleagues and his family.“After two years of doing this job, that was a first for our team and it came just before our final performance of the season.Together and individually, we all quietly watched the aftermath unfold from a distance thinking about the Indian maintenance crew standing on the ramp next to an empty parking spot, aircraft ladder laid on the ground, the pilot's belongings still in his rental car,” Hiester wrote as he headed back to the US.The Tejas aircraft was in the middle of an eight-minute aerobatic display when it suddenly lost altitude during what appeared to be a low-level manoeuvre. Visuals aired across several channels showed the jet diving toward the ground before erupting into flames, sending thick black smoke over Al Maktoum International Airport. Spectators, including families with children, watched in shock as emergency teams rushed to the scene.
Article Summary: Wing Commander Namansh Syal of the Indian Air Force was honoured with a ‘Missing Man’ manoeuvre by the Russian Knights aerobatics team. The Russian Knights released a video of their performance at the Dubai Airshow 2025, paying tribute to the pilot and honouring the lives lost.

Article Title: Salute and tears: Wing Commander Afshan's emotional goodbye to husband; Namansh Syal was killed in Tejas crash
Article Text:
Photo: ANI screengrab

IAF Officer Namansh Syal Flown Back to India After Tejas Jet Crash in Dubai Air Show

How the tragic mishap occurred?

NEW DELHI: Wing Commander Afshan saluted her husband, Wing Commander Namansh Syal, as she paid her last respects to him.Wing Commander Namansh Syal lost his life in the LCA Tejas crash in Dubai on 21st November.The mortal remains of Wing Commander Namansh Syal were brought to his native village of Patialkar in Himachal Pradesh’s Kangra district on Sunday.Villagers, family members and officials gathered to pay emotional tributes as his last rites are set to be performed.The Indian Air Force (IAF) confirmed the pilot’s demise after the aircraft crashed and burst into flames during a low-level aerobatic demonstration at Al Maktoum International Airport, Dubai on Friday.Local residents and friends described Syal as a “gem” and the pride of their village and school.Sandeep Kumar, a local, said, “We are from the same village as Namansh, Patialkar. Everyone in our village is sad. He was like our younger brother. This should not have happened. We do not have words. We met him 3-4 months ago when he visited our village.”Pankaj Chadha, who studied alongside Wing Commander Namansh Syal, recalled their school days and how he was a gem."I have also studied in the same school as Namansh, Sainik School Sujanpur Tira. We have lost one of our gems. He was the pride of our school. We will go to his native village, Patialkar. He made all of us very proud," Chadha said.The Tejas Mark-1 fighter jet was performing an eight-minute aerobatic demonstration when it could not recover from a low-altitude “negative G-turn,” plunging to the ground and erupting into flames in front of a large audience.Visuals from the Dubai Air Show showed the jet crashing and sending thick black smoke into the sky. Emergency teams rushed to the site, but Wing Commander Syal could not eject in time and sustained fatal injuries.This was the second crash involving the lightweight multi-role Tejas since its induction into the IAF a decade ago. The first crash, near Jaisalmer in March last year, saw the pilot safely eject. The IAF has ordered a court of inquiry to ascertain the cause of the crash, coordinating with Dubai aviation authorities and recovering the aircraft’s black box.Veteran pilots highlight that such accidents can occur due to sudden loss of power, control malfunction or spatial disorientation during negative G maneuvers
Article Summary: Wing Commander Namansh Syal lost his life in the LCA Tejas crash in Dubai on 21st November. The Tejas Mark-1 fighter jet was performing an eight-minute aerobatic demonstration when it could not recover from a low-altitude “negative G-turn,” plunging to the ground.

Article Title: Gisele Bündchen implied that prioritizing Tom Brady for years took a personal toll: “When you love someone, you don’t put them in jail”
Article Text:
Supermodel Gisele Bündchen reflects on her marriage to Tom Brady, describing their split as a "death and rebirth." She details her shift from supporting his career to rediscovering her own dreams and personal fulfillment. Bündchen emphasizes that true success lies in authenticity and self-discovery, moving forward on her own terms.

Gisele Bündchen's shifting balance between support, career and self-fulfillment

Moving from high-stakes partnership to reinventing life on her own terms





In her March 2023 interview with Vanity Fair, supermodel Gisele Bündchen opened up about her 13-year marriage to former NFL quarterback Tom Brady, how their lives evolved, and what she discovered in the space that followed. While details of their split had played out in headlines, Bündchen offered fresh context and a more nuanced perspective.Gisele Bündchen admitted that the marriage was “like a death and a rebirth,” and described her own shift from supporting a partner’s career to rediscovering her personal dreams. Her reflections reveal not just a high-profile breakup, but a woman reclaiming her voice and defining success on her own terms.When Gisele Bündchen first met Tom Brady at age 26, she said she was, “so ready” for family and partnership. Traditionally one of the world’s highest-earning models, Bündchen gradually scaled back her runway work after 2015 to support the family life they were building..Gisele Bündchen describes relocating to Tampa without ever having lived there before, “When we moved to Tampa, I actually had never been there before.I just arrived and that was my life.” Yet despite her enormous success, much of the public narrative painted her as “against football” or overshadowed by Brady’s career, a portrayal she calls “very hurtful” and “the craziest thing I’ve ever heard.”Gisele Bündchen underscores that marriage didn’t unravel overnight. “That takes years to happen.” As she puts it, “Sometimes you grow together; sometimes you grow apart … When you love someone, you don’t put them in a jail and say, ‘You have to live this life.’ You set them free to be who they are..”Gisele Bündchen's message: supporting someone doesn’t mean losing yourself, and that truth became clearer to her as her kids grew and her dreams quietly changed..Today, Gisele Bündchen speaks of her next act in Costa Rica, building a home, raising her children, and exploring wellness and nature far from red carpets. She asserts, “I have my own dreams..”While Tom Brady continued his historic career, Bündchen’s focus shifted inward. She embraced spiritual practices, daily rituals, and the idea that success is not just professional acclaim but authenticity and fulfillment. She says the breakup felt like both a loss and a liberation, “I believed in fairy tales when I was a kid. I think it’s beautiful to believe in that.”..Gisele Bündchen's reflection on Brady is remarkably gracious. “Listen, I have always cheered for him, and I would continue forever … If there’s one person I want to be the happiest in the world, it’s him.”In doing so, Gisele Bündchen rejects reductive headlines and stereotypes, choosing instead to present a fuller picture of love, change and self-discovery. As she said, “What’s been said is one piece of a much bigger puzzle. It’s not so black and white.”In the end, this isn’t a story solely of one of fashion’s biggest icons, Gisele Bündchen stepping aside. It’s the story of a woman stepping forward, redefining when a chapter ends, a new one begins..Gisele Bündchen is back on the red carpet. The Brazilian supermodel made a rare event appearance at the Fashion Trust Arabia 2025 Awards Ceremony in Doha, Qatar, hosted over the weekend.Also Read: Gisele Bündchen’s post divorce evolution raises question: did Tom Brady underestimate what letting her go would cost him?
Article Summary: Supermodel Gisele Bündchen opened up about her 13-year marriage to former NFL quarterback Tom Brady. She described their split as a "death and rebirth," and described her own shift from supporting a partner’s career to rediscovering her personal dreams.

Admiration across sports is not a new thing. Recently, Caitlin Clark talked about her source of inspiration during childhood. And it was none other than a book written by one of the greatest female soccer players of all time. The name of the book was “Winners Never Quit” by Mia Hamm. She even led her team to win their first gold medal at the Atlanta Olympics in 1996. The book is a documentation of her journey in learning patience and developing resilience, the two most important things in sports.In a recent interview, Caitlin Clark was asked about her greatest source of inspiration.It took no time for the athlete to reveal her favorite source of inspiration. Clark, while making the revelation, stated, “My favorite book growing up. It was like ‘Winners Never Quit.’ This picture book and it was about Mia Hamm.”She went on to explain how the book played a major role in her life. Caitlin further added, “And I remember like when I used to read books before I went to bed with my parents, that was the one I always wanted to pick. Like that’s just has been her ability, it’s just really to inspire people and to give back. And I don’t think I would be her if it wasn’t for them.” Clark credited all her career success to Mia and the USA Women’s soccer team.Mia was overwhelmed by listening to Clark’s statement. Article Title: ‘Burden to carry’: Jason Kelce’s wife Kylie pushed over the edge by his athleticism in viral clip
Article Text:
Kylie Kelce reacts after Jason Kelce shuts down her viral “more athletic” prank on “Not Gonna Lie.” (Image via Getty)

Kylie Kelce says Jason Kelce’s confidence ‘makes me mad’ after his viral podcast answer

Jason Kelce’s viral moments keep following the couple, and Kylie keeps talking about them

Kylie Kelce went viral this week after a simple question on her podcast turned into a marriage moment that fans can’t stop replaying. The former field hockey player tried a TikTok prank on her husband, retired Philadelphia Eagles center Jason Kelce, and his reaction didn’t just shut the prank down, it irritated her for a reason she didn’t bother hiding.The clip aired on the Nov. 20 episode of her podcast “Not Gonna Lie,” where Kylie tested a trend that usually puts partners on the defensive. Jason didn’t bite. And Kylie wasn’t thrilled that the confidence was completely genuine.Kylie called Jason during the taping and dropped the trend’s signature question: “Do you ever wish you were more athletic?”Jason didn’t hesitate. “Oh gosh, not really. I feel like I’m pretty athletic,” he said.Kylie kept the bit going, but Jason quickly realized he was on-air. Then he doubled down and answered again, this time even more direct.“I don’t know. I feel like sometimes I’m so athletic it’s a burden to carry. I wish that the expectation was lower, you know what I mean?”The call ended, and that’s when Kylie let the audience in on how she really felt.“He was just like, ‘No, I’m good. I’m really f**ing athletic.’* And he’s not lying, that’s the part that makes me mad,” she said on the show.“We’ve got to figure out how we’re going to knock him down a few notches. And I mean that in a loving way. Because that’s part of my job.”The frustration wasn’t real anger. It was the kind of irritation that comes from knowing the other person didn’t fall for the prank because the answer was too honest to mock.And that was the part she couldn’t get over.This prank wasn’t the first time Kylie dissected her husband’s behavior on the podcast. Earlier in the same episode, she roasted a “Smells Like Jason Kelce” candle and joked about fans needing her permission to even sniff it.She also recently reacted to Jason’s now-famous Speedo moment from his summer charity event. The former center stripped down to a patriotic swimsuit for the Eagles Autism Foundation, something Kylie admitted she did not enjoy watching online later.“I did not like that you just [were like], ‘Hey world, here’s my t-int.’ It’s mine,” she said, keeping the same deadpan delivery fans love from her.Jason had told his brother Travis Kelce on “New Heights” that he needed a wax before the Speedo reveal and described being told to “assume the butterfly position.”“I am filleted open,” he joked.Between viral stunts, parenting four kids, and two wildly successful podcasts, Jason and Kylie have become one of football’s most-watched couples, and Kylie’s honesty about all of it is why clips like this one explode instantly.

Article Title: Mets great Darryl Strawberry reveals emotional moment Donald Trump cleared drug and tax issues in Tulsa
Article Text:

Darryl Strawberry recalls his phone call with Donald Trump after the $502,043 tax case and drug charges

Darryl Strawberry opened up about a big moment in his life on Sunday, when he spoke at a church in Tulsa, Oklahoma. The former New York Mets star thanked Donald Trump for giving him a full pardon for his old legal cases. The pardon was signed on November 7, and Darryl Strawberry said it changed his life in a way he never expected.During the sermon, Darryl Strawberry told the crowd that the pardon felt like a fresh start after many hard years. He said God helped him through the moment and gave credit to Donald Trump for taking action when others did not. His words came as he talked about his past, his family, and his faith in front of the church members.Darryl Strawberry had many legal problems during the second half of his MLB career. In 1994, he faced a tax evasion case for not reporting $502,043 in earnings. He received two years of probation and six months of house confinement.Donald Trump erased that record with a full presidential pardon twenty-one years later, on November 7.“God just completely set me free when he gave me a pardon from President Donald J. Trump,” Darryl Strawberry stated during the sermon.He further claimed past presidents had opportunities but no one responded.In 1999, he was charged with drug and prostitution-related crimes; this was among his other legal problems.He was given twenty-one months of community service and probation. He served 18 months in prison in 2002 for violating his probation and several rules at a rehabilitation center.According to Darryl Strawberry, these years were the worst of his life. Meeting Tracy, his wife, at a drug rehabilitation conference in 2005 changed the course of his life for the better.The pair next became ministers; both held the same Christian convictions. Officially ordained in 2024, Darryl Strawberry stated that faith changed his life.He also discussed on Sunday the early morning call he got from Donald Trump on November 6. He told The Associated Press, “We just talked about my baseball career in the 1980s… he joked that he could not hit a baseball.”Darryl Strawberry said the president then told him, “You did some very bad things, but today you are clean. I am wiping everything out.”Darryl Strawberry won the World Series with the New York Mets in 1986 and with the New York Yankees in 1998 and 1999. His No. 18 is retired by the Mets, and he entered their Hall of Fame in 2010.Also Read: Sabrina Carpenter Stuns Los Angeles Crowd As She Proudly Wears Los Angeles Dodgers Jersey During Huge Tour Show

Weight rules and reputational risks heighten the stakes for Anthony Joshua

Jake Paul has responded to the doubts that have emerged about his proposed fight with Anthony Joshua in December He insists the fight is real, and says the scepticism is just driving him on.The American content creator-turned-fighter feels such disparagement will vanish with the ringing of the bell, and insists hitting Joshua would mute the naysayers 'saying this fight could never happen.' It will be for eight three-minute rounds under traditional pro rules (including knockouts), and will be permanently recorded on the professional records of both fighters.However, observers are warning Joshua, an Olympic gold medallist and former unified world champion, could find his reputation in a heap of trouble if he has any losses. Paul is not the boxer Joshua is, but his upward trajectory has transformed a fight that many initially dismissed as a gimmick into one that people are genuinely interested in seeing. More coverage on Shedeur Sanders:

In August, when Cleveland Browns quarterback Shedeur Sanders’ mother, Pilar Sanders, arrived at her son’s first NFL (preseason) game in a crop top and cargo pants, she instantly became the center of a social media storm. Critics unleashed a wave of harsh comments like, “Mom look like she in her 20s man” and “I would be embarrassed if my 60 year old mom was conducted herself like that,” as well as “Very inappropriate be a mom not a groupie” and “Looks like she’s auditioning for an X-rated movie. That steadfast support shone through in November, when her son surprised the world with his talent.Sanders took the field as the starting quarterback against the Las Vegas Raiders and mesmerized the crowd with a 66-yard touchdown pass to running back Dylan Sampson: his first ever in the NFL. He also threw a 52-yard deep ball in the first quarter, caught by rookie Isiah Bond, who celebrated his own first career touchdown.Even star defensive end Myles Garrett, fresh off three sacks, was left flabbergasted by the play. The Raiders never stood a chance, as the Browns claimed a thrilling 24-10 victory. Pilar Sanders was there for every moment, proudly sporting a striking, rookie-inspired portrait outfit.Pilar Sanders illuminated the stands in Cleveland’s signature orange and matte black. Her collared, buttoned orange jacket popped over a round-neck graphic crop top, which showcased a bold square full of innumerable small “12” numbers and a striking image of Shedeur Sanders in full Browns gear, football in hand, eyes scanning the field for his receiver. Another oversized “12” blazed in orange at the corner. Beneath, a hint of white spaghetti strap peeked out, paired with dark blue jeans. The jacket’s extra-long drawstrings nearly brushed her mid-thigh, adding a casual and sporty edge. Pilar’s look was finished with understated makeup, a sweep of pink gloss, dramatic kohl-lined eyes, chunky silver earrings, and a huge ring glistening on her finger. Her luscious black hair tumbled in loose curls. Article Text:
Palak Muchhal reacts to Palash–Smriti Mandhana wedding delay

Smriti Mandhana's Father And Fiance Palash Muchhal Rushed To Hospital, Wedding Postpones!

NEW DELHI: Indian playback singer Palak Muchhal has made a statement after the postponement of her brother Palash Muchhal 's wedding to India cricketer Smriti Mandhana due to health concerns on Sunday."Due to Smriti's father's health, Smriti and Palash's wedding has been put on hold. Article Title: Lindsey Halligan disqualified: Why federal judge threw out former Miss Colorado finalist's attempt to prosecute former FBI chief James Comey
Article Text:
How Lindsey Halligan landed at the centre of the storm



COMEY CASE IMPLODES: ‘Fatal' Grand Jury Twist; Trump DOJ Defends Lindsey Halligan After Big 'Error'

Why the judge ruled her appointment unlawful



How this invalidated the Comey and Letitia James prosecutions



What the charges actually were



Why this ruling reshapes Trump’s strategy



President Donald Trump, joined by Steve Witkoff, U.S. Attorney General Pam Bondi, Karoline Leavitt, White House press secretary, Lindsey Halligan, White House Deputy Chief of Staff, Dan Scavino, and Arabella Kushner, watches play between Carlos Alcaraz, of Spain, and Jannik Sinner, of Italy, during the men's singles final of the U.S. Open tennis championships, Sunday, Sept. 7, 2025, in New York. (AP Photo/Yuki Iwamura)

What happens next







The two most politically charged prosecutions of the season — the cases against James Comey and Letitia James — ended not with a dramatic courtroom revelation, but with something far more fundamental: the prosecutor who brought them should never have been a prosecutor in the first place. In one ruling, a federal judge dismantled the legal foundation on which the indictments rested and forced the Justice Department to confront how it allowed an unlawfully appointed attorney to lead cases of this magnitude.Lindsey Halligan had been a familiar face in Trump’s orbit long before she became a headline. She worked in insurance litigation, later joined Trump’s legal team, and held a White House role. Before any of that, she even appeared in the Miss Colorado USA pageant — a detail that made for easy social-media fodder but had no bearing on the courtroom battle that followed. What mattered was that Halligan had never served as a federal prosecutor, and yet she was suddenly placed at the head of one of the most powerful prosecutorial offices in the country.Her appointment as interim US attorney for the Eastern District of Virginia set off immediate debate, not because of her résumé, but because of the way she arrived in the job. A previous interim US attorney was pushed out, and Halligan was installed as a second interim replacement.That one administrative manoeuvre would unravel everything that came next.Federal law is clear: the attorney general may appoint only one interim US attorney before the role must be filled through Senate confirmation. The administration ignored that process entirely. By replacing one interim appointee with another, it bypassed the Senate, concentrated power in the hands of a loyalist, and turned a temporary exception into a revolving door.When the judge examined Halligan’s appointment, the conclusion was unavoidable. She had no lawful authority to hold the office, and therefore no authority to convene a grand jury, present evidence, or sign indictments. Everything she touched — including the Comey and Letitia James cases — collapsed instantly, because the law requires that prosecutors themselves must be legally installed before they can legally act.Halligan did not merely participate in the prosecutions; she was the prosecutions. She alone presented the cases. She alone signed the indictments. She alone drove them forward, pushing past internal resistance and capitalising on the urgency created by an expiring statute of limitations in the Comey case. When her role was declared illegitimate, the indictments themselves evaporated. There was no backup prosecutor, no co-signatory, no safeguard built into the process. Removing her meant removing the cases entirely.The judge did not weigh the evidence or the political implications. She simply ruled that the legal mechanism used to bring the charges had failed. Without a properly appointed prosecutor, there was no prosecution.James Comey was accused of giving false statements to Congress about media leaks during the FBI’s politically sensitive investigations. Letitia James was accused of mortgage-related fraud involving a Virginia property. Both figures are frequent critics of Donald Trump, which gave the prosecutions a political edge, but the judge avoided commenting on motive. The sole issue was whether the cases were brought by someone empowered to bring them at all.Trump’s broader effort to pursue high-profile adversaries depended heavily on speed, loyalty and tightly controlled decision-making. That strategy now faces a structural problem: if the administration bypasses the rules that govern prosecutorial appointments, any case built on such appointments collapses upon inspection. In this instance, the urgency to file charges, the removal of a reluctant interim US attorney, and the rushed installation of Halligan created a chain of events that could not withstand legal scrutiny.The judge’s decision is more than a setback; it is a warning about the consequences of treating the Justice Department as a political instrument rather than an independent institution governed by clear statutory limits.The cases were dismissed “without prejudice,” which means the Justice Department can attempt to refile them. But doing so requires a lawfully appointed or Senate-confirmed US attorney, a willing grand jury, and a viable statute of limitations — especially in Comey’s case, where the deadline has likely already passed. Even if the administration appeals, time and procedure now work against it.The immediate impact is simple: the prosecutions of James Comey and Letitia James no longer exist. The broader impact is more profound. A judge has reminded the administration that the law governs not only defendants, but prosecutors too — and that even the most ambitious retribution campaign cannot function outside the boundaries of appointment, authority and constitutional process.
Article Summary: Lindsey Halligan had no lawful authority to hold the office, and therefore no authority to convene a grand jury, present evidence, or sign indictments. Everything she touched — including the Comey and Letitia James cases — collapsed instantly. The law requires that prosecutors themselves must be legally installed before they can legally act.

John Cena backs Tyrese Haliburton with a powerful 3-word message



Tyrese Haliburton shows progress as full recovery remains ahead



Tyrese Haliburton’s road back to the floor has drawn national attention, and this week it gained support from one of the most recognizable figures in sports entertainment. As the Indiana Pacers guard works through recovery from a torn Achilles tendon, his determined approach continues to resonate far beyond the NBA. But every small leap, including a left-handed dunk during practice, has renewed optimism around his long-term return. His latest viral moment prompted Cena’s response.When Tyrese Haliburton’s practice dunk surfaced on social media, John Cena reposted the clip with a message that read: “#NeverGiveUp.” It was meaningful coming from a 17-time WWE Champion whose catchphrase has followed him for more than a decade. Haliburton has long admired Cena and the WWE, and the sentiment fit the guard’s approach as he continues to push through a difficult recovery.Their friendship has become a lighthearted thread in Haliburton’s rise.The All-Star even appeared at SummerSlam in August, where Cena taunted him before grabbing one of Haliburton’s crutches to use in a scripted scuffle with Cody Rhodes. It doubled as a playful heel turn from Cena and a fan-favorite moment for Haliburton, who has never hidden his love for professional wrestling.In recent comments, Tyrese Haliburton said he is “a little bit ahead” of schedule as he works his way back from the torn right Achilles tendon he suffered in Game 7 of the NBA Finals on June 22, 2025.He landed hard after driving to the basket and collapsed immediately, ending his postseason after a remarkable stretch of clutch performances.Achilles injuries typically require eight to ten months of recovery, and the Pacers announced in July that he would miss the entire 2025–26 campaign. Still, his one-foot dunk before the team’s matchup against Detroit offered a snapshot of how far he has come.
